page.title: 01Outline of the D_block
page.content: Clevedon is situated in the hundred(a subdivision of a county with its own court)of Portbury.It is on the coast of the Bristol Channel,in the County of Avon,open to the Atlantic Ocean. The name Clevedon is derived from "Clivedone"...clive = cliff...and done = valley.It was under this name that it was mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086. The D_block which we surveyed contained most of the old part of Clevedon,from Hangstone Hill to Walton St. Mary and East Clevedon. We also included Walton_in_Gordano, Walton Moor,Norton's Wood and Land Yeo. The M5,a motorway of three lanes each way,crosses the D_block.This has been of crucial importance to the development of Clevedon.There is now easy (and quick) access to Bristol,and the M4,to the north.Clevedon is on the main holiday route to the south_west.
